title: About
text:
Iâ€™m Guillaume Gilles, a former Banque de France financial analyst who now channels a decade of risk assessment and teaching into cybersecurity.

For over ten years at the Banque de France, I decoded macroeconomic patterns, assessed corporate resilience, and produced strategic insight for decision-makers. My academic side ran parallel â€” teaching statistics, financial analysis, and information systems at top business schools, instilling analytical rigor and adaptability.
Hands-on with GitHub, I write, experiment, and explore: bridging data, defense, and human behavior to uncover and harden vulnerabilities.
Today, Iâ€™m immersed in cybersecurity, building skills in digital forensics, secure network design, and incident investigation. My passion lies at the nexus of data, security safeguards, and the behaviors that drive human error.

title: Resume
text:
Conduct macroeconomic analyses and forecasts for the Nouvelle-Aquitaine region, covering topics such as inflation, growth, and economic trends. Prepare monthly synthesis reports on regional economic trends to support strategic decision-making for business leaders.






Teach descriptive and inferential statistics, as well as information systems management, to students in the Grande Ã‰cole program. Apply adaptive teaching methods to accommodate varying student levels and foster academic success.






Deliver advanced financial analysis courses to masterâ€™s students, emphasizing real-world case studies to strengthen understanding of key concepts and their professional applications.






Analyzed the solvency of major French corporations, specializing in consolidated accounts (IAS/IFRS and French standards). Produced detailed financial reports to formalize credit risk recommendations, aiding strategic decisions for banking institutions.






Final-year internship focused on invoice control and accounting. Managed client invoicing and payment tracking, and contributed to monthly and annual closings.
